tool.name: DockingPie
tool.purpose: It is a pymol plugin for molecular docking
tool.users: everyone, it is designed to be user friendly
tool.inputs_outputs: It is designed to be used within PyMOL, so it is easy to just load any format the user prefer, and DOckingPie does the rest

items: Does this tool use community-accepted structural formats and conventions?
Are residue, atom, chain, and ligand identifiers preserved consistently?
Would another tool interpret the output in the same way without custom fixes?
Are assumptions about data representation explicit and documented?
Could a mismatch produce plausible but incorrect results without raising errors?
